DataElement.preferredName: Liver Stiffness Measurement Interquartile Range Median Ratio Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Liver stiffness measurement results obtained by means of transient elastography and expressed as the ratio of the interquartile range of liver stiffness to the median (IQR/M).

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The modulus of elasticity of the liver, representing the resistance of the liver to deformation. Liver stiffness has been shown to be a surrogate marker of advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis. Liver stiffness, measured by transient elastography, is an independent predictor of liver failure, hepatocellular carcinoma, and mortality in cirrhotic patients coinfected with the human immunodeficiency virus or acquired immune deficiency syndrome, and hepatitis C virus._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The modulus of elasticity of the liver, representing the resistance of the liver to deformation. Liver stiffness has been shown to be a surrogate marker of advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis. Liver stiffness, measured by transient elastography, is an independent predictor of liver failure, hepatocellular carcinoma, and mortality in cirrhotic patients coinfected with the human immunodeficiency virus or acquired immune deficiency syndrome, and hepatitis C virus.

Concepts.definition: The modulus of elasticity of the liver, representing the resistance of the liver to deformation. Liver stiffness has been shown to be a surrogate marker of advanced fibrosis and cirrhosis. Liver stiffness, measured by transient elastography, is an independent predictor of liver failure, hepatocellular carcinoma, and mortality in cirrhotic patients coinfected with the human immunodeficiency virus or acquired immune deficiency syndrome, and hepatitis C virus.

Property.preferredDefinition: Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 10/4/2017 wz created for DCP SVAR NWU2015-06-03.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The difference between the 3d and 1st quartiles is called the interquartile range and it is used as a measure of variability (dispersion)._The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it._Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The difference between the 3d and 1st quartiles is called the interquartile range and it is used as a measure of variability (dispersion).:The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it.:Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The difference between the 3d and 1st quartiles is called the interquartile range and it is used as a measure of variability (dispersion).
The value which has an equal number of values greater and less than it.
Quotient of quantities of the same kind for different components within the same system.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
